image.altText: Beau Lamarre in a police uniform

props.synopsis: New South Wales Police Commissioner Karen Webb moves to dismiss alleged murderer Beau Lamarre-Condon from the force, flags investigation of his background and files.

title.children: NSW Police Commissioner begins process to dismiss murder-accused officer from the force

image.altText: Ben Yole holds bridle of a horse.

props.synopsis: A leading harness trainer who was the subject of a report into race fixing, team driving and animal welfare concerns will be back racing this weekend, as the governing body that temporarily banned him faces criticism over it how it handled its disciplinary action.

title.children: Harness trainer at centre of racing scandal wasn't afforded 'natural justice' when banned

image.altText: A truck dumping stuff on ground at farm.

props.synopsis: A paper company, salmon farmer and water authority provide their industrial waste to a compost facility. But after a mass fish death event — and fines in court — there are calls for things to change.

title.children: A waste spill into a Tasmanian river killed 100,000 fish. Now the mayor says enough is enough

image.altText: The rear of a plane with wheels down about to land on a runway

props.synopsis: As Tasmanians get ready to vote in a state election, experts are predicting a gloomy time ahead for the state, with a shrinking population and economic downturn expected.

title.children: From rags to riches, to rags again — is Tasmania's dream run over?

image.altText: A bald man in a suit with his hands clasped on a desk

props.synopsis: An unnamed former Australian politician, who was successfully cultivated by an international spy ring, once suggested bringing a prime minister's family member into contact with his foreign handlers.

title.children: ASIO reveals plot by retired politician to introduce a prime minister's family member to foreign spies

image.altText: Smoke rises above trees.

props.synopsis: Residents in the Victorian town of Dereel are warned to leave immediately, as their properties come under threat from a fast-moving grassfire ignited during a day of extreme fire risk.

title.children: Emergency warning for fire south of Ballarat as strong winds sweep Victoria

image.altText: Michelle Heyman of the Matildas celebrates a goal.

props.synopsis: The Matildas are just one game away from qualifying for the Paris Olympic Games after a 3-0 win in the first leg. Follow live.

title.children: Red-hot Matildas put 8 past Uzbekistan in first-half demolition

image.altText: a close up shot of a man's face staring to the distance. He has short mousy brown hair and a short beard.

props.synopsis: Text messages reveal a News Corp journalist offered to write an article defending former Northern Territory Police constable Zachary Rolfe two days after he fatally shot dead Kumanjayi Walker.

title.children: 'You did nothing wrong': News Corp journalist's texts to Rolfe aired at inquest

image.altText: A sale sign outside a major retail outlet.

props.synopsis: Consumer prices rose 3.4 per cent over the year to January, steady at the same annual rate of inflation as in December.

title.children: Households warned of 'difficult' year ahead, even as inflation slows to its lowest level since 2021

image.altText: A woman in a blue police shirt stares ahead

props.synopsis: The NSW government supports the state's police commissioner Karen Webb following heavy criticism she has faced over comments she made to the media.

title.children: Police minister says she has 'unequivocal confidence' in NSW commissioner after criticism

image.altText: A child sits behind a box of peanuts.

props.synopsis: An injectable medication can reduce the risk of serious food allergy reactions after just four months of use in some people, according to a new study. But there are a few caveats.

title.children: 'Life-changing' injection for food allergies approved in US, not yet on the cards in Australia

image.altText: Caterina Mete shares her pregnancy announcement

props.synopsis: For those who have gone through IVF, are solo mothers, used a donor — or are donor conceived themselves — it was a powerful moment of feeling seen.

title.children: 'I wish I had have known from a young age': Wiggles pregnancy helping to 'normalise' IVF and donor conception

image.altText: Sydney Mardi Gras

props.synopsis: NSW Police officers will march in the Mardi Gras day parade after the board changed their earlier decision asking them not to attend.

title.children: NSW Police officers allowed to march at Sydney Mardi Gras, but not in uniform

image.altText: Sydney couple luke davies and jesse baird were allegedly murdered on Monday February 19

props.synopsis: 2024's Mardi Gras will be remembered as the year of pain. Not for the first time, the spectre of violence hangs over the parade. This time it allegedly comes from a police officer and one of the community's own, writes Jason Om.

title.children: Justice must be served for Luke Davies and Jesse Baird. How NSW Police achieve it will be heavily scrutinised

image.altText: Ukraine Ambassador

props.synopsis: The Ukrainian community has appealed directly to Defence Minister Richard Marles to lead a "whole of government" approach to better coordinate Australia's military and humanitarian aid to the war-torn country.

title.children: Ukraine pleads with Australia to donate 'desperately needed' military equipment

image.altText: A woman in a black outfit walking out of court, showing her middle finger to the camera.

props.synopsis: A 27-year-old woman avoids jail time after pleading guilty in the Perth Magistrates Court to assaulting and choking her seven-month-old baby.

title.children: Woman who sent photos of herself assaulting her baby to child's father avoids jail

image.altText: A woman wearing a hijab and a man make a love heart with their hands.

props.synopsis: Maryam Sayed Deeb and Abdullah Abu Nahl got married during the Israel-Gaza war, but two days later they were killed in an Israeli air strike.

title.children: 'She did not have time to be happy': Maryam was killed days after marrying the love of her life

image.altText: Police officers stand by police tape

props.synopsis: Police say the victim was shot in the groin on the ninth floor of an office building in Sydney's CBD this afternoon.

title.children: Law firm workers restrain alleged gunman after man shot on ninth floor of office in Sydney CBD

image.altText: An old black and white group photo with a man in glasses and a woollen jumper spotlighted in red.

props.synopsis: The Victorian Education Department sent unqualified teachers into classrooms in the 1960s and then failed to sack them following reports they were sexually abusing their students, according to recently discovered documents.

title.children: 'An educated man who preyed on his students': Woman sues Victorian government over alleged abuse by high school teacher

image.altText: A graphic showing snapshots of a dark-haired woman.

props.synopsis: In 1997 Marion Barter quit her job, sold her house and told family she was going overseas. No-one has heard from here since, but her daughter has never stopped pushing for answers.

title.children: After decades of mystery, coroner prepares to deliver findings on fate of Marion Barter

image.altText: A smiling man with neat grey hair.

props.synopsis: One of the organisers of the Albany Pride Festival says councillor Thomas Brough's remarks are "ridiculous" and "laughable".

title.children: WA councillor doubles down on claim paedophiles welcome in LGBTQIA+ community

image.altText: Emergency services attend to someone underneath multiple silos

props.synopsis: Emergency services cut through the collapsed bottom of a silo at a rural Queensland property to help the trapped man who was "drowning" in grain.

title.children: Rescuers free man 'drowning' in grain underneath collapsed silo using shovels and front-end loader

image.altText: people walking outside a store

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has ended flat after trading on Wednesday, while Australia's annual inflation remained at its lowest level since November 2021.

title.children: Inflation remains at two-year low, Optus and Sony announce hundreds of job cuts, ASX finishes flat — as it happened

image.altText: a screen shows a calculator that can assist people to understand how tax cuts will affect them.

props.synopsis: Want to know how much you'll benefit from tax cuts coming in July? Use our tax cut calculator to find out.

title.children: Stage 3 tax cuts calculator: See how the new cuts will affect you

image.altText: A woman placing her vote into a ballot box at a polling station on election day in Funafuti, the capital of Tuvalu.

props.synopsis: The landmark agreement struck between Australia and Tuvalu last year provided more immigration opportunities for residents of the climate change-threatened nation, but allows for Australia to veto potential security agreements with regional rival China.

title.children: Tuvalu may revisit landmark security deal amid sovereignty concerns

image.altText: Roman Heinze in a singlet.

props.synopsis: The man convicted of the brutal assault on two young backpackers at Salt Creek, in South Australia's Coorong region, has lost his bid to prevent the vehicle used in the attack being destroyed.

title.children: Judge orders Salt Creek attacker Roman Heinze's car to be crushed

image.altText: A man smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: The family of Dougie Hampson walks out of an inquest as a doctor apologises for his death, which came less than 24 hours after Mr Hampson was discharged from Dubbo Base Hospital.

title.children: Senior doctor tells inquest the death of misdiagnosed Aboriginal man will 'stay with him' for life

image.altText: A text message reading: 'Medicare: Due to the recent abnormal operation of your Medicare, we have to suspend your service.'

props.synopsis: Australian authorities say the newest scam threatens to suspend or freeze Medicare accounts.

title.children: Authorities say 'spike' in Medicare scam text messages

image.altText: Jordan Thompson reacts during 2024 Australian Open.

props.synopsis: It seems Jordan Thompson's efforts in winning his first ATP Tour singles championship and then the doubles crown in Los Cabos have caught up with the 29-year-old.

title.children: Thompson tumbles in Acapulco only days after winning first ATP Tour title

image.altText: Astronomical clock in Prague

props.synopsis: Without adding an extra day to February almost every four years, a lot more would happen to us than you might think. We break down the science, and history, behind this ancient phenomenon.

title.children: It's a leap year, so why do we have to add a bonus day to our calendar again?

image.altText: A split image of three Australian women's tennis players, the wearing Australian colours and the one in the middle in aqua.

props.synopsis: Sam Stosur faces a telling selection call as Australia's new Billie Jean King Cup captain prepares for an April qualification tie against Mexico in Brisbane.

title.children: Sam Stosur faces big call for Australia's Billie Jean King Cup tie

image.altText: Ken Rutherford and Allan Border talk

props.synopsis: Australia and New Zealand are the closest of sporting rivals. But when it comes to Test match cricket, tours between the two are all too often an afterthought.

title.children: It's annoyingly rare for Australia and NZ to play Test cricket against each other, and all boils down to one reason

image.altText: Max Strus

props.synopsis: Max Strus hits an incredible 18m buzzer beater to bring the Cleveland crowd to its feet in its NBA clash with Dallas.

title.children: Buzzer-beating shot from well beyond mid-court sees Cavaliers down Mavericks

image.altText: A TV still of Gordon Cormier, a Canadian Filipino teenager dressed as Avatar, poised for a fight. A man in a mask looms behind.

props.synopsis: The new live-action Avatar: The Last Airbender on Netflix keeps the premise of the animated original but fails to live up to its effortlessly astounding spectacle.

title.children: This is what happens when you shove Avatar: The Last Airbender into the Netflix machine

image.altText: Band members wearing all black with faces covered by masks.

props.synopsis: Hitler salutes, white supremacy slogans and symbols of hate … insiders say Nazi bands have become an open secret within Australia's metal scene, as fans prepare for the return of major international event Knotfest next month.

title.children: 'You've booked a Nazi band': The dark side of Aussie metal
